summary: Forgot Password feature verification completed successfully. All 9 backend API tests passed (100%) and all 6 frontend UI tests passed (100%). The forgot password flow works end-to-end: users can click 'Forgot password?' in login modal, enter email, receive confirmation message, and return to login.
passed_tests: Backend: POST /api/auth/forgot-password with valid email returns 200 + generic success message
Backend: POST /api/auth/forgot-password with non-existent email returns 200 (no user enumeration - security)
Backend: POST /api/auth/forgot-password with missing email field returns 422 validation error
Backend: POST /api/auth/forgot-password with invalid email format returns 422 validation error
Backend: POST /api/auth/forgot-password with empty email returns 422 validation error
Backend: POST /api/auth/forgot-password is idempotent (multiple calls safe)
Backend: POST /api/auth/reset-password with invalid token returns 400
Backend: POST /api/auth/reset-password with missing token returns 422
Backend: POST /api/auth/reset-password with missing password returns 422
Frontend: Login modal opens when clicking LOGIN button (data-testid='login-btn')
Frontend: 'Forgot password?' link visible in login modal (data-testid='forgot-password-link')
Frontend: Clicking forgot password shows reset form (data-testid='forgot-password-form')
Frontend: Forgot password form has email input (data-testid='forgot-email') and submit button (data-testid='forgot-submit')
Frontend: Submitting form with valid email shows success state (data-testid='forgot-password-sent')
Frontend: 'Back to Sign In' button (data-testid='back-to-login') returns to login form
seed_data_creation: None - no persistent test data created
context_for_next_testing_agent: Forgot Password feature is fully functional. The email sending service is MOCKED - the backend processes requests and generates reset tokens, but actual emails are not delivered (NullEmailProvider is used when email_enabled=false in site settings). The POST /api/auth/forgot-password endpoint correctly returns a generic success message regardless of whether the email exists (security best practice to prevent user enumeration). The frontend correctly displays the forgot password form in AuthModal.js with proper data-testid attributes.
mocked_api_note: EMAIL SERVICE IS MOCKED - Password reset emails are processed and tokens are generated, but emails are NOT actually sent. The NullEmailProvider is used when email is not configured in site settings. To enable real email delivery, admin must configure an email provider (SendGrid, Resend, Mailgun, Postmark) in the admin settings.
